Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

src.repository.contacts.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, current_user: User) → Contact¶

Create a new contact in the database for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – Data schema for creating the contact.

  • current_user (User) – The current user on behalf of whom the contact is created.

Returns:

The created contact object.

Return type:

Contact

src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int) → bool¶

Delete a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact to be deleted.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be deleted.

Returns:

True if the contact was successfully deleted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int) → Type[Contact]¶

Retrieves a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, user: User, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10) → List[Type[Contact]]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, user: User, contact: ContactUpdate) → Type[Contact]¶

Update an existing contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – Data schema containing updated contact information.

Returns:

The updated contact object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
